llm.feedback:
Up | 0–3 months | EU autos relief via prompt EU legislation could reduce MFN 15% tariffs on autos and EU-origin supply chains, while the broader 15% basket remains for most EU goods and energy/investment commitments signal a durable bargain that could reprice risk premia if enacted quickly | EU auto-tariff language and legislative speed | 40% (RHFWI02JT)(9)(8)
Up | 3–6 months | Regime re-pricing via acceleration of selective deregulation and compression of policy risk premia could lift capex and margins, with DOE grants to Group14 and Sila and Korea plant ownership accelerating the domestic battery-materials build-out | Progress on Group14/Sila projects and related regulatory moves | 30–35% (9W8ZUIBDY)(3T8AGCL7T)(DNG58CC09)
Down | 3–6 months | Tariffs accelerate or broaden beyond baseline, driving higher import prices and inflation pass-through toward the 18–20% range with broader sectoral spillovers | Enforcement signals, USMCA/CUSMA origin uptake progress, and near-term tariff trajectories | 35–45% (OFY11YO0I)(AJTHKYXQ3)(19)
Down | 0–3 months | Druzhba oil pipeline disruption narrative points to energy-security frictions that could elevate energy volatility and widen pricing gaps across commodities and industrials | Druzhba flow developments and corroborating energy-market signals | 25–30% (CWVWSACA7)
